page.title: 09MEMORIES OF A NONAGENARIAN
page.content: We went to visit 90 year old Mr.Alf Fuller and his wife. He has lived all his life in Newick, as did his father and generations before him. Alf, his father and his grandfather had all been plumbers and their old plumbers shop is at this moment being re-erected at the Weald and Downland Open Air Museum at Singleton. His father installed the pump on the Green in 1897 to provide drinking water for the villagers. Alf remembers the days when they only had candles and oil lamps for lighting, when cooking was done on open'ranges' and when his wife drove the horse-driven milk float to the creamery at Sheffield Park. Mr Fuller's Aunt Elizabeth ran a private school for boys and girls, charging a shilling a week. She ran the school single-handed and was also Church organist for 50 years.
